boardMembers.name: Salome Aluso
boardMembers.bio: Salome holds a Bachelor's degree in Education (Arts) from the University of Nairobi, a Master's degree in Applied Linguistics from Ohio University, and is currently completing her PhD in Higher Education Administration & Student Affairs at Ohio University. As a former Fulbright scholarship recipient, she has taught Swahili at both the high school and college levels. Her expertise in curriculum design, grant writing, and student advocacy makes her an invaluable member of our board. Currently based in Kenya, she volunteers with community organizations focusing on youth and women empowerment.
education: PhD Candidate, Higher Education Administration & Student Affairs - Ohio University
achievements: Successful Grant Writer (Swahili STARTALK, Summer Bridge Program)
Former Assistant Director for Multicultural Student Affairs at Ohio Wesleyan University

boardMembers.name: Jennie Chen
boardMembers.bio: Bridging data, psychology, and community empowerment, Jennie Chen has extensive expertise in social marketing, data analysis, data products, and community engagement. She excels in leveraging digital data to enhance content strategies, understand audience behavior, and build thriving community cultures. Her work with major brands and dedication to community advocacy through initiatives like Keep Austin Dog Friendly demonstrate her commitment to fostering positive change and meaningful connections.
education: PhD, Social Psychology - Texas A&M University
MA, Social Psychology - Texas A&M University
BA, Psychology - The University of Texas - Austin
achievements: Led impactful events including Cupcake Smackdown and TEDxAustin experiences
Worked with major brands including Amazon, Walmart, Target, and The Home Depot
Active member of Austin Food Blogger Alliance

boardMembers.name: Susan Kavaya
boardMembers.bio: Susan is pursuing a PhD in public health at Indiana University-Bloomington, specializing in Health Behavior and adolescent health. Her research focuses on adolescent sexual and reproductive health issues. Born and raised in Kenya, Susan has worked extensively with adolescents and young people as a teacher, peer educator, and researcher. Her experience spans high school and university levels, including teaching public health and Kiswahili.
education: PhD Candidate, Public Health - Indiana University-Bloomington
MS, School and College Health Education - Indiana University-Bloomington
achievements: Fulbright Foreign Language Teaching Assistant at Yale University (2013)
Expertise in adolescent sexual and reproductive health research
Experience teaching at both high school and university levels
